content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 28 Jul 2018Is it wise for a PR park his money under CPF and let them grow?I'm a SPR and from Sarawak. I wonder if I can volunteerly top up my money into CPF and some days when I'm retired I just give up my PR and get all my money back? Any advise.4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Isabella JoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 28 Jul 2018With the high interest rate offered by CPF, I would say yes, it's wise. Of course the disclaimer is that it is based on current terms and conditions. No one can guarantee if there might be change in tnc next time before you retire. 0 comments1

Joseph SimLevel 1. FreshieAnswered on 30 Jul 2018Do note that if you give up PR, it does not auto entitle you to withdraw money from CPF unless you hit their retirement conditions. If not, you will have to close the entire CPF account to withdraw. After which, you will no longer be able to work in Singapore because CPF will not allow you to open the account again. 0 comments0
James YeoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 29 Jul 2018I think if you are thinking of becoming a pr for long, its good to park in cpf. If you want cashflow though, better to go for othrr options0 comments0
Choon Yuan ChanLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 29 Jul 2018Yes,​CPF rates returns are better than endowment (if comparison is made against OA rates) and against WL (in SA rates)​0 comments0
